logic

Class Backbone

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Backbone

  • public class Backbone
extends java.lang.Object
    The main parser for the users commands, apply´s the changes to the saved Account´s and stores them for further usage.
    Author:
    erik heinisch

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      A ArrayList containing all Account´s that exist in this Backbone.

      The parsing result created by the JSAP.

      The Java-Simpel-Argument-Parser JSAP determinate´s the users divine will.
      private java.lang.String saveFile
      A String representing a path to the folder where the Account´s are saved loaded from.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Backbone

        public Backbone(java.lang.String[] args)
         throws com.martiansoftware.jsap.JSAPException
        Constructs a new Backbone initializes the JSAP and creates several FlaggedOption´s to react on in the later programm. As next step args is parsed to a JSAPResult by the JSAP. This JSAPResult can be used later to determinate the users desires. All old Account´s are deserialized and the users command is executed on the accounts. After the command was processed all Account´s are serialized again.
        Parameters:
        args - The users command in String´s
        Throws:
        com.martiansoftware.jsap.JSAPException - Parsing problems by the JSAP.

    • Method Detail

      • mkAccount

        private void mkAccount()
        Creates a new Contact based on the parameters given by the JSAP.

      • rmAccount

        private void rmAccount()
        Removes a Account based on the parameters given by the JSAP.

      • getAccount

        private void getAccount()
        Returns either all Account_id´s after printing their lenght '3 My_mail_address erik.heinisch@aol.de Eriks_drittMail' or a special property belonging to a specified Account. The reaction of this method is directly dependent of the arguments given to the JSAP.

      • modAccount

        private void modAccount()
        Modifies the Account with the arguments extracted by the JSAP.

      • mkMail

        private void mkMail()
        Creates a new Contact based on the parameters given by the JSAP.

      • rmMail

        private void rmMail()
        Removes a Mail based on the parameters given by the JSAP.

      • getMail

        private void getMail()
        Returns either all Mail_id´s of all Account´s or a special property belonging to a specified Mail of a specified Account. The reaction of this method is directly dependent of the arguments given to the JSAP.

      • modMail

        private void modMail()
        Modifies the Mail with the arguments extracted by the JSAP.

      • mkContact

        Creates a new Contact based on the parameters given by the JSAP.

        Removes a Contact based on the parameters given by the JSAP.

        private void getContact()
        Returns either all Contact_id´s of all Account´s or a special property belonging to a specified Contact of a specified Account. The reaction of this method is directly dependent of the arguments given to the JSAP.

        private void modContact()
        Modifies the Contact with the arguments extracted by the JSAP.

      • printHelp

        private void printHelp()
        Prints the File help.txt.

      • serialize

        public void serialize(java.lang.String p_saveFilePath)
        Serailizes all Account´s in the ArrayList accounts to the directory given by the parameter. To prevent file duplication all files in the directory are deleted with the deleteFolder(File) method before they are written.
        Parameters:
        p_saveFilePath - The directory in which to save the Account´s.

      • deleteFolder

        public void deleteFolder(java.io.File p_saveFolder)
        Deletes all File´s in the directory given by the parameter.
        Parameters:
        p_saveFolder - The directory to clean up.

      • deserialize

        public void deserialize(java.lang.String p_readFilePath)
        Deserializes all Account´s found in the directory represented by the parameter, and adds them to the accounts list.
        Parameters:
        p_readFilePath - The path to search for Account´s

      • noAccounts

        private void noAccounts()
        Prints an error message, if the programm is started with a parameter that requires at least one account, but there is none.
